conditionally_allowed.condition: Dynamic linking only - no static linking
conditionally_allowed.rationale: LGPL-3.0 allows dynamic linking without copyleft contamination. psycopg2-binary is used as a dynamically linked library only.

lgpl.rule: LGPL libraries are conditionally allowed ONLY if used via dynamic linking. Static linking of LGPL code is FORBIDDEN. All LGPL dependencies must be explicitly listed in conditionally_allowed with justification.
lgpl.enforcement: CI must verify dynamic linking only for LGPL dependencies

agpl.rule: AGPL is FORBIDDEN in all forms. This includes AGPL-1.0, AGPL-3.0, and any AGPL variants. AGPL requires source code disclosure for network services, which is incompatible with RansomEye commercial licensing.
agpl.enforcement: CI must fail immediately on any AGPL dependency detection

gpl.rule: GPL (GPL-2.0, GPL-3.0) is FORBIDDEN in all forms. GPL requires derivative works to be GPL-licensed, which is incompatible with RansomEye commercial licensing.
gpl.enforcement: CI must fail immediately on any GPL dependency detection

llm_models.rule: LLM models used in RansomEye (via llama-cpp-python, transformers, etc.) must have permissive licenses. Model weights may have separate licensing terms. All model licenses must be documented in THIRD_PARTY_INVENTORY.json. Proprietary models require explicit customer agreement.
llm_models.enforcement: Model license validation is separate from code license validation. Model licenses are tracked in inventory notes field.

kernel_syscalls.rule: Use of Linux kernel syscalls via standard library (libc, Rust std, Python stdlib) does NOT constitute GPL contamination. Syscalls are interfaces, not derived works. This is explicitly allowed.
kernel_syscalls.enforcement: No enforcement needed - syscall usage is standard and legal

grafana_agpl.rule: Grafana uses AGPL-3.0. If Grafana or any AGPL component is required, it MUST be deployed as a separate service with clear boundaries. Direct code integration is FORBIDDEN. If used, must be documented as customer_supplied distribution_scope.
grafana_agpl.enforcement: Any Grafana dependency must be flagged for manual review

dual_licensed.rule: Dual-licensed packages (e.g., 'Apache-2.0 OR MIT') are ALLOWED. RansomEye may choose either license term. Default to the more permissive option (MIT) when both are available.
dual_licensed.enforcement: Dual licenses are treated as permissive and allowed

core.definition: Core RansomEye platform components distributed with main product
core.license_requirements: Must use allowed_licenses only, or conditionally_allowed with explicit approval

agent.license_requirements: Must use allowed_licenses only. Agents are distributed separately but are part of core product.

dpi.license_requirements: Must use allowed_licenses only. DPI components have strict security requirements.

optional.definition: Optional components that may not be deployed in all installations
optional.license_requirements: Must use allowed_licenses only. Customer must explicitly opt-in.

customer_supplied.definition: Components supplied by customer, not by RansomEye
customer_supplied.license_requirements: Customer responsibility. Must be documented but not validated by RansomEye.

inventory_completeness.rule: Every dependency in requirements.txt, Cargo.toml, package.json must be listed in THIRD_PARTY_INVENTORY.json

forbidden_detection.rule: Any dependency with forbidden_licenses must cause immediate CI failure
forbidden_detection.enforcement: license_scan.py and validate_licenses.py must check against forbidden_licenses

version_pinning.rule: All dependencies must have explicit version constraints (no unpinned dependencies)
version_pinning.enforcement: validate_licenses.py must verify version constraints exist

license_accuracy.rule: License information in inventory must match actual package licenses. Manual verification required for new dependencies.
license_accuracy.enforcement: Manual audit process - automated tools may not detect all license variants

audit_requirements.frequency: Quarterly full audit, continuous CI validation
audit_requirements.documentation: All license decisions must be documented in THIRD_PARTY_LICENSES.md
audit_requirements.approval: New conditionally_allowed licenses require legal review
